creditline: The Louis W. Hill, Jr. Fund
description: dark brown lacquer with gold flecks; hexagonal design with floral motifs in gold on cover
medium: Black lacquer with sprinkled gold designs
text: Tea masters collected small boxes made of wood, lacquered wood, ceramic, metal, or bamboo for holding incense used in the tea ceremony. Particularly prized were small lacquered boxes originally used by noblewomen for cosmetics. This box is decorated with stylized flowers (<I>hanabishi<I>) within geometric tortoise-shell shapes (<I>kiko_<I>), a pattern adopted from textile designs.
title: Incense Box (Kogo_)
